metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14296 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
canUnpack in p_vmlinx.cpp in UPX 3.95 allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (SEGV or buffer overflow, and application crash) orpossibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted UPX packed file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14296` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

upx-ucl - 3.95-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: upx-ucl package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.95-2').
